All Implemented Interfaces:
ISortController<M>, org.jdesktop.swingx.sort.SortController<M>
public class JYTableSortController<M extends javax.swing.table.TableModel>
extends org.jdesktop.swingx.sort.TableSortController<M>
implements ISortController<M>

Enhanced SortController for TableModels which supports multiple-column sorts.

getSortIndex

public int getSortIndex(int columnIndex)
Description copied from interface: ISortController
Returns the sort index of the column. That is, its position in the list of sort keys, if contained and sorted, or -1 if not.

Specified by:
getSortIndex in interface ISortController<M extends javax.swing.table.TableModel>
Parameters:
columnIndex - the column in model coordinates
Returns:
the sort index, that is the position in the list of sort keys if contained and sorted or -1 if not

toggleSortOrder

public void toggleSortOrder(int columnIndex,
                            boolean isMultipleSort)
Description copied from interface: ISortController
Toggles the SortOrder of the given column in either single-sort or multiple-sort modus, depending on the boolean flag.

Implementations must respect the per-controller and per-column sortable property.

Specified by:
toggleSortOrder in interface ISortController<M extends javax.swing.table.TableModel>
Parameters:
columnIndex - the column in model coordinates
isMultipleSort - a boolean indicating sort modus, true denotes mult-sort, false denotes single-sort

Removes SortKeys with SortOrder.UNSORTED from the list.
